description:

In this powerful, testimony, Janick Christen joins Becket Cook from Switzerland to share her journey through childhood trauma, identity confusion, gender dysphoria, medical transition (including hormones and surgeries), and the moment she says God confronted her with a choice that changed everything. This conversation walks through the pain, the beliefs, the questions, and the cost‚Äîthen traces what she describes as a step-by-step restoration of identity through surrender to Jesus.

Janick speaks candidly about mental health battles, the complexity of family dysfunction, and why she believes ‚Äúfruit‚Äù in someone‚Äôs life isn‚Äôt the same as God‚Äôs approval. If you‚Äôve wrestled with identity, faith, suffering, or how Christians should respond with truth and compassion, this episode is for you.

Janick Christen's Book: https://www.amazon.com/dp/2970145715
Her Ministry Website: https://trans4freedom.org

Author and pastor Jamie Bambrick joins Becket Cook to talk about his new book,
‚ÄúSet Free in a World of Chaos and Confusion: Only Jesus Can Save and Set You Free.‚Äù

They discuss how the gospel offers real freedom in a culture that‚Äôs deeply confused about identity, sexuality, and truth.

Jamie shares the story behind his viral response to the ‚ÄúHe Gets Us‚Äù Super Bowl ad and why a Jesus who only ‚Äúrelates‚Äù to us‚Äîbut never calls us out of sin‚Äîfalls short of the biblical Christ. From there, the conversation moves into the big questions: God, evil, suffering, and why our intuitions about right and wrong point beyond a purely material universe.

Along the way, you‚Äôll hear powerful glimpses of lives radically changed by Christ and a clear, hopeful explanation of what it actually means to be ‚Äúset free.‚Äù If you‚Äôre a skeptic, a struggler, or a believer looking for clarity in the chaos, this episode will challenge you to reconsider who Jesus is and what He offers.

Francis opens up about his lifelong struggle with insecurity, fear of rejection, and striving for God‚Äôs approval ‚Äî and the radical encounter that changed everything.

Together, they explore:
‚ú® What ‚Äúperfect love casts out fear‚Äù really means

‚ú® The spiritual attacks he faced while writing his new book, Beloved
‚ú® Why biblical literacy is essential to defeating the enemy‚Äôs lies

This episode is packed with wisdom, Scripture, honesty, and encouragement.
If you‚Äôve ever struggled with fear, insecurity, dryness in prayer, or feeling distant from God‚Ä¶ this conversation will deeply strengthen your faith.

In this powerful episode, Becket Cook welcomes Branden, who shares one of the most intense and supernatural testimonies you will ever hear. From childhood encounters with angels and demons, to years of struggling with same-sex attraction, shame, and spiritual oppression, Branden‚Äôs story unfolds with raw honesty and vulnerability.

As Branden walks us through his battles with identity, addiction, spiritual warfare, and ultimately stepping into the LGBT lifestyle, he also reveals the moments where God intervened‚Äîthrough visions of Jesus, deliverances, and divine mercy. This journey is shocking, emotional, and deeply thought-provoking as Branden recounts encounters that shaped his faith and pulled him back from darkness.

Whether you‚Äôre someone wrestling with similar questions, struggling with identity, or simply curious about the reality of spiritual warfare, Branden‚Äôs testimony will challenge you, encourage you, and offer a rare look into the perseverance required to return to Christ. Stay till the end‚Äîhis final breakthrough is unforgettable.

description:

In this episode of The Becket Cook Show, Becket sits down with Vlad, a young man who was convinced he was born gay and lived that identity for years‚Äîsecretly, painfully, and hopelessly. Growing up in rural Romania with a nominal faith, Vlad slowly fell into pornography, hookup culture, and deep isolation. His life spiraled in Germany where depression and addiction took over, even while he still called himself a ‚ÄúChristian.‚Äù

But then something unexpected happened. A testimony on this very channel interrupted everything. That video led to real Bible study, real confession, real community, and ultimately‚Äîa real encounter with Jesus Christ.

Vlad moved to London, walked into a global Christian gathering, and there, surrounded by believers, he finally understood the cross. He chose repentance, baptism, and a new life in Christ. Since that moment, everything is different. Temptations still exist, but he is no longer alone, no longer hopeless, and no longer defined by his past.

This is a story about identity, deception, love, spiritual warfare, and the power of God to rescue anyone. Share this with someone who needs hope.

20:55 ‚Äì The YouTube testimony that changed everything

In this powerful episode Becket Cook talks to Jason Mellard, a man whose journey from childhood trauma and same-sex attraction to healing, faith, and family will leave you deeply moved. Jason reveals how years of confusion and pain‚Äîrooted in sexual abuse and a fractured relationship with his father‚Äîultimately inspired him to create his transformative ‚ÄúFour S Framework‚Äù: Separation, Sensation, Sin, and Story. This life-changing approach helps men better understand the roots of same-sex attraction and find restoration through truth, identity, and God‚Äôs grace.

As Jason recounts his father‚Äôs tragic struggle, his own path through recovery, and how he ultimately found freedom, purpose, and love through Christ, viewers are offered an authentic look at redemption in action. Today, Jason is a husband, father of three, and a coach helping men overcome shame, reconnect with God, and live lives full of purpose and possibility. His story is both heartbreaking and deeply hopeful‚Äîa testament to how God can transform even the most broken past into a radiant future.

In this powerful interview, Becket Cook talks with Lare McCreary, who shares his remarkable story of God‚Äôs redemption. Growing up as a pastor‚Äôs kid in Missouri, Lare struggled with feelings of rejection and same-sex attraction from an early age. Though he loved Jesus deeply, he wrestled for years to reconcile his faith with his desires ‚Äî until he discovered his true identity in Christ. Through grace, perseverance, and obedience, Lare chose to trust God‚Äôs design, ultimately finding freedom, peace, and purpose in his walk with Christ.

Today, Lare is married to his wife Amy and is the father of four children. His story is a testament to God‚Äôs faithfulness, showing that no struggle is beyond His redemption. In this honest and heartfelt conversation, Lare and Becket discuss faith, identity, and the power of God to transform lives ‚Äî a message of hope for anyone seeking truth and wholeness in Jesus.

To reach out to Lare: info@manofgod.life

In today's episode, former MTV Real World: Denver cast member Davis Mallory joins Becket Cook to share his powerful testimony of redemption ‚Äî from coming out as gay on national television to hearing directly from God through supernatural dreams that transformed his heart and life.

After 20 years of living as a ‚Äúgay Christian,‚Äù Davis experienced a radical awakening: prophetic encounters, convicting dreams, and a renewed understanding of God‚Äôs truth about sin, identity, and freedom in Christ.

In this raw and emotional conversation, Becket and Davis unpack childhood wounds, fatherlessness, the deception of hedonism, and the true joy that comes from obedience to Jesus.

Stephen Bennett‚Äôs life is a powerful testimony of redemption and transformation. In this raw and emotional interview with Becket Cook, he shares how God rescued him from a homosexual lifestyle, healed deep wounds from his childhood, and gave him a new life as a husband, father, and minister.

From growing up with a brilliant yet broken father, to surviving childhood trauma, to living a fast-paced nightlife in New York and Provincetown, Stephen opens up about the pain, emptiness, and constant search for affirmation that defined his early years. But everything changed when he encountered Jesus Christ. Today, Stephen is joyfully married, raising a family, and leading a ministry that reaches the LGBT community with truth and love.

If you‚Äôve ever wondered whether real transformation is possible, or how God‚Äôs grace can rewrite even the most difficult story, this episode will deeply encourage you.

description:

In today's episode, Rev. Dr. Harold Ristau‚Äîparish pastor, former military chaplain, missionary, and seminary professor, now at Luther Classical College‚Äîjoins Becket Cook to unpack his new book, "Spiritual Warfare and Deliverance: How to Minister to the Demonically Oppressed and Possessed." They tackle why modern skepticism about demons persists, how rationalism distorts a biblical worldview, and why deliverance belongs to the pastoral office. Dr. Ristau explains the difference between oppression and possession, the role of Scripture, fasting, and humility, and why deliverance is more ‚Äúart + science‚Äù than a mechanical formula.

You‚Äôll hear practical counsel for house cleansing, using sacred Scripture aloud, and building a post-deliverance life (church, Word, prayer). Dr. Ristau walks through the ‚ÄúRAT principle‚Äù (trap, kill, remove the crumbs), cautions against turning psychology into a catch-all, and even weighs in on the ‚Äúaliens‚Äù question through a spiritual lens. If you‚Äôre looking for sober theology with concrete tools for real spiritual battles, this conversation is both bracing and deeply pastoral.

Join Becket Cook for today's episode with Donovan O'Connor. Donovan's life reads like a Hollywood script‚Äîdrugs, sex, violence, and high-profile encounters with the rich and powerful. From a troubled childhood marked by abuse and constant chaos to years lost in substance abuse, sexual addiction, and the dangerous world of male prostitution, his story dives deep into the hidden darkness of Los Angeles nightlife. Donovan pulls no punches as he reveals shocking experiences, near-death overdoses, encounters with celebrity clients, and the spiritual emptiness that fame and pleasure could never fill.

This is more than a testimony‚Äîit‚Äôs a raw, unfiltered account of transformation through the power of Jesus Christ. Donovan‚Äôs journey from brokenness to redemption will inspire anyone battling addiction, pornography, destructive relationships, or hopelessness. Packed with real-life drama, faith-filled turning points, and spiritual insights, this gripping interview is a must-watch for those seeking freedom, healing, and proof that no one is beyond God‚Äôs grace.

Why are so many Christians compromising on LGBTQ issues? In this powerful and deeply personal conversation, Becket Cook sits down with Katy Faust, founder of Them Before Us, to unpack the cultural, theological, and relational pressures that lead Christians to cave, and why holding firm to biblical truth is both necessary and loving. They discuss Chip and Joanna Gaines, the dangers of normalization in media, the slippery slope to apostasy, and how to stand for truth without sacrificing compassion. Whether you're a parent, pastor, or just navigating these issues in your own circle, this episode will challenge and equip you with truth, grace, and conviction.

Read Katy's Substack: https://thembeforeus.substack.com

In this thought-provoking episode, Becket Cook delves into the state of same-sex marriage a decade after the landmark Obergefell v. Hodges decision (2015), which legalized gay marriage across the U.S. 

Reflecting on an article by Bryan Dumont in The Dispatch, Becket Cook, a former member of the gay community turned Christian, explores why marriage equality has seemingly faded from LGBTQ activism. Citing cultural shifts toward intersectional issues like trans liberation and racial justice, the discussion critiques the prevalence of non-monogamy in gay male relationships and questions the impact of same-sex marriage on traditional values. 

With personal anecdotes, references to influential figures like Andrew Sullivan, and a conservative Christian lens, the video challenges viewers to consider whether the "experiment" of gay marriage has succeeded or failed, while speculating on its future. A compelling blend of cultural analysis, personal testimony, and social commentary.

Raised in a non-denominational Christian home in Western Washington, Kyle grew up with a strong faith foundation but faced challenges when he realized his same-sex attraction during his teenage years. Struggling with secrecy, guilt, and an addiction to pornography, Kyle‚Äôs journey took him through a failed relationship with a woman and years of openly dating men, all while feeling distant from his faith.

In this heartfelt conversation, Kyle opens up about a life-changing moment in November 2024, when overwhelming guilt from infidelity led him to a non-affirming church in Los Angeles. There, a sincere prayer for God to take control and an unexpected encounter with a compassionate church friend sparked a profound spiritual awakening. Through uncontrollable sobbing, worship, and repentance, Kyle experienced God‚Äôs transformative power, leading him to leave his relationship and return to his faith.

Now living with his supportive parents in Idaho, Kyle reflects on his ongoing spiritual journey, the challenges of overcoming old habits, and the freedom he‚Äôs found in his renewed relationship with Jesus Christ. This powerful testimony highlights the love and grace of Christian parents, the importance of community, and the life-changing impact of surrendering to God.

ABOUT BECKET:
Becket Cook was born and raised in Dallas, Texas. He attended Jesuit College Preparatory
School of Dallas. After graduating from college, Becket moved to Los Angeles to pursue his dream of writing and acting, finding success in both. He eventually went on to become a production designer working with the top photographers and directors in the world on fashion shoots for magazines such as Vogue and Harper‚Äôs Bazaar, and for ad campaigns such as Gap, L'Or√©al Paris, and Nike.
 
Finding a new sense of freedom in L.A., Becket also fully engaged in his new life as a gay man. He had a series of many relationships with men throughout the next fifteen years. 
In September of 2009, Becket met a stranger at a coffee shop in Silver Lake who invited him to his church in Hollywood called Reality L.A. Becket reluctantly agreed to attend the service. After hearing the sermon that Sunday, Becket was utterly transformed by the gospel and gave his life to Christ. He also knew on that day when God revealed Himself to him that homosexuality was a sin and that he could no longer live that life. Becket was more than happy to count everything as loss because of the surpassing worth of knowing Christ Jesus his Lord.

Becket spends much of his time in ministry speaking at churches, universities, and conferences helping believers (and non-believers) understand this issue biblically, theologically, culturally, and personally. Balancing grace and truth when teaching on this subject is of primary importance. His goal is to challenge the current cultural narrative about sexuality in general and homosexuality in particular by demonstrating through his personal testimony and biblical truths that, yes, homosexuality is still a sin, and that following Christ is infinitely more satisfying and joyous.

He has lived all over the world in major cities such as Rome, Vienna, and Tokyo.

Becket graduated from Talbot School of Theology at Biola University in 2017 with a Master of Arts in Theology. 

Becket‚Äôs book, A Change of Affection: A Gay Man‚Äôs Incredible Story of Redemption, with a 
foreword by Francis Chan, published by Thomas Nelson, released July 30, 2019.

title: Armie Hammer's Mother Speaks Out: Dru Hammer Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 183
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In this episode, Becket Cook sits down with Dru Hammer, author of the captivating memoir "Hammered," which dives deep into her extraordinary life. As the granddaughter-in-law of legendary tycoon Armand Hammer and mother of actor Armie Hammer, Dru shares personal stories about her upbringing, faith, and family dynamics. We explore her idyllic childhood, her unique entrance into the Hammer family, and her inspiring journey of forgiveness, resilience, and rebuilding after challenges in her marriage.

We also discuss her passion projects, including the Hammered Heart Foundation and her creative venture Druville, which supports single mothers through vibrant designs and heartfelt initiatives. Along the way, Drew reveals her unshakable faith, the lessons learned from her experiences, and even her candid reaction to Armie's Hollywood roles.

This is a must-watch for anyone seeking inspiration, faith, and a glimpse into a life filled with both opulence and redemption. Grab your copy of Hammered on Amazon or Druville.com to support a great cause!

title: What Causes Same-Sex Attraction? Dr. Nicolosi Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 180
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In this captivating discussion, Becket Cook chats with Dr. Joseph Nicolosi Jr., a renowned clinical psychologist and Clinical Director at the Breakthrough Clinic. They dives deep into the psychological, familial, and cultural factors contributing to same-sex attraction. Drawing from the groundbreaking work of his father, Dr. Joseph Nicolosi Sr., author of Shame and Attachment Loss, we explore:

The developmental stages of boys and how family dynamics influence identity.
The role of father-son relationships and the concept of the "kitchen window boy."
How unmet needs for male attention, affection, and approval can shape attraction.
The intersection of temperament, sensitivity, and societal narratives.
Why some boys eroticize their longing for male connection and the pathways to healing.
Dr. Nicolosi Jr. offers a scientific perspective on these deeply personal and spiritual topics while emphasizing the freedom for individuals to choose their therapeutic goals.

https://www.josephnicolosi.com/

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 180

Time Stamps

1. **Introduction & Guest Introduction (0:00)**
   - Opening remarks and introduction of Dr. Joseph Nicolosi Jr.
   - Discussion about Dr. Nicolosi Sr.'s book *Shame and Attachment Loss*.

2. **Foundational Concepts (3:00)**
   - Why some boys develop same-sex attractions.
   - Family dynamics and early childhood experiences.

3. **Father-Son Dynamics (8:00)**
   - Role of father detachment and criticism.
   - Importance of gender identity development in boys.

4. **Mother's Role & "Kitchen Window Boy" (15:00)**
   - Impact of over-involvement and high-anxiety mothers.
   - The concept of the "kitchen window boy."

5. **Temperament and Sensitivity (20:00)**
   - How sensitive temperaments influence development.
   - Genetic predisposition vs. environmental factors.

6. **Sibling and Peer Relationships (25:00)**
   - Impact of bullying, older siblings, and peer rejection.

7. **Eroticized Envy and Same-Sex Attraction (30:00)**
   - Psychoanalytic explanation of same-sex attraction.
   - Role of "eroticized envy" in relationships.

8. **Cultural and Social Observations (35:00)**
   - Gay identity, societal narratives, and challenges.
   - Study on gay couples and monogamy.

9. **Defense Mechanisms & False Self (40:00)**
   - Development of the "false self" for self-protection.
   - Good little boy syndrome, hyperfemininity, and hypermasculinity.

10. **Fantasy and Theater Allure (45:00)**
    - Coping mechanisms and allure of acting/theater.
    - Connection between dissociation and creative expression.

11. **Unmet Needs and Promiscuity (50:00)**
    - Desire for male attention and approval.
    - Promiscuity as a form of unresolved childhood trauma.

12. **Path Forward and Healing (55:00)**
    - Grief work, psychotherapy, and spiritual perspectives.
    - Resources and Dr. Nicolosi's therapeutic approach.

13. **Conclusion (1:00:00)**
    - Final thoughts, resources, and closing remarks.

title: The AMAZING Story of Joshua Broome - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 176
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with Joshua Broome about his journey from porn star turned follower of Christ! 

We also discuss his book, ‚Äú7 Lies That Will Ruin Your Life: What My Journey from Porn Star to Preacher Taught Me About the Truth That Sets Us Free.‚Äù

A former porn star-turned-preacher reveals seven lies our culture tells us and guides us to the only thing that creates authentic happiness: a relationship with Jesus.

Joshua Broome knows this firsthand. He had a successful career in the adult film industry, making lots of money and achieving notoriety and all the markers of success. And yet he felt empty inside. After hitting rock bottom, he cried out to Jesus ... and it was only then that he was fully redeemed.

In 7 Lies That Will Ruin Your Life, Joshua examines seven things we are told will make us happy and shows how each of them points us back to our need for God. 
 
Using his own journey as a point of reference, 7 Lies That Will Ruin Your Life pairs his personal experiences with Biblical truths, demonstrating both  how we can be deceived and the healing truth that comes when we realize that Jesus really is enough.

title: Why I'm Protestant: Dr. Gavin Ortlund @TruthUnites  Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 175
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, I chat with Dr. Gavin Ortlund about his new book, ‚ÄúWhat It Means To Be Protestant: The Case For an Always-Reforming Church.‚Äù 

These days many evangelicals are exploring the more sacramental, liturgical, and historically-conscious church traditions, including Roman Catholicism and Eastern Orthodoxy. This hunger for historical rootedness is a welcome phenomenon--but unfortunately, many assume that this need can only be met outside of Protestant contexts.

In What it Means to Be Protestant, Gavin Ortlund draws from both his scholarly work in church history and his personal experience in ecumenical engagement to offer a powerful defense of the Protestant tradition. Retrieving classical Protestant texts and arguments, he exposes how many of the contemporary objections leveled against Protestants are rooted in caricature. Ultimately, he shows that historic Protestantism offers the best pathway to catholicity and historical rootedness for Christians today.

title: How Progressives Exploit Christian Compassion: Allie Beth Stuckey - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 174
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with Allie Beth Stuckey about her new book, ‚ÄúToxic Empathy: How Progressives Exploit Christian Compassion.‚Äù 

We are told that empathy is the highest virtue‚Äîthe key to being a good person. Is that true? Or has ‚Äúempathy,‚Äù like so many other words of our day‚Äî ‚Äútolerance,‚Äù ‚Äújustice,‚Äù ‚Äúacceptance‚Äù‚Äîbeen hijacked by bad actors who exploit compassion for their own political ends?

In Toxic Empathy, Allie Beth Stuckey argues that empathy has become a tool of manipulation by left-wing activists who bully people into believing that they must adopt progressive positions to be loving. She explores the five most heated issues through which toxic empathy is deployed: abortion, gender, sexuality, immigration, and social justice. Progressives use catchy mantras to present their perspective as empathetic, like ‚Äúabortion is healthcare,‚Äù ‚Äúlove is love,‚Äù or ‚Äúno human being is illegal,‚Äù but in each case, they ignore the other side of the moral equation. For example, abortion is presented as compassionate for the woman, but what about the human life the procedure kills?

"Toxic Empathy" Book: https://amzn.to/4e5Vcmt

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with Megan Basham, a culture reporter for the Daily Wire, about her new book, ‚ÄúShepherds For Sale: How Evangelical Leaders Traded the Truth for a Leftist Agenda.‚Äù 

Liberal theology isn‚Äôt new. Pastors and theologians have drifted, slipped, or even plunged into doctrinal error for centuries. But in recent decades, Daily Wire reporter Megan Basham reveals, well-funded forces from outside the church have been sowing seeds of discord from behind the scenes.

In Shepherds for Sale, Basham documents how progressive powerbrokers ‚Äîfrom George Soros, to the founder of eBay, to former members of the Obama administration‚Äî set out to change the American church. Secular foundations and think tanks have deliberately targeted Christian media, universities, megachurches, nonprofits, and even entire denominations, not to mention many high-profile pastors and influencers, with infiltration and astroturf campaigns. Their goal: to co-opt the church for political purposes. In exchange for toeing a left-wing line, many of those church leaders and institutions have received cash, career jumps, prestige, and praise. 

Now, many evangelical leaders are pushing their members to ‚Äúwhisper‚Äù about sexual sins, reconsider the importance of abortion, lament the effects of climate change, and repent of ‚Äúperpetuating systemic racism.‚Äù Meanwhile, America‚Äôs largest evangelical denominations are fraught with division over issues like critical race theory, and many ministries once known for publishing sound doctrine are now promoting social justice.

A rigorously reported expos√©, Shepherds for Sale serves as a warning of what can happen when a church forgets that true power lies not in the world‚Äôs wisdom, but in Scripture.

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with J Warner Wallace about his new book, ‚ÄúThe Truth in True Crime: What Investigating Death Teaches Us About the Meaning of Life.‚Äù

In his book, Wallace explores the clues lying behind our human nature as he uncovers fifteen life-truths gleaned from both contemporary murder investigations and ancient Biblical wisdom, among them human beings were created:
For worship
For community
To pursue humility
To seek justice and mercy 

Wallace uses his experience as a homicide detective to give one-of-a-kind look at human nature, the struggles we face, and how each of us desires and seeks Truth. title: Revival in California: Ross Johnston Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 150
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, I chat with Ross Johnston. Ross Johnston is a revivalist who is a leader and co-founder of California Will Be Saved. He is also one who is on the frontlines in leading revival in California as well as on a mission to unite the body of Christ. California Will Be Saved is a movement that hosts mass corporate gathering outdoors in major cities of influence across California with live worship, the proclamation of the gospel and baptisms. 

Ross was born by artificial insemination and grew up in a lesbian household with two moms. At 15 years old he was invited to church where he encountered the Holy Spirit and presence of God for the first time in his life. He then surrendered his life to Jesus and became born again during that time.

title: The Deconstruction of Christianity: Alisa Childers & Tim Barnett - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 147
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, I chat with Alisa Childers and Tim Barnett about their new book, ‚ÄúThe Deconstruction of Christianity: What It Is, Why It‚Äôs Destructive, and How to Respond.‚Äù 

A movement called ‚Äòdeconstruction‚Äô is sweeping through our churches and it is affecting our loved ones. It has disrupted, dismantled, and destroyed the faith of so many, and this book can help you not only understand what‚Äôs happening but also stand your ground and respond with clarity and confidence.

Maybe you have a loved one who is deconstructing their faith, and you are struggling to know how to respond;

Maybe you are trying to understand the radical spiritual makeover your friend or family member is going through;

Maybe your relationship with a loved one has been strained or even cut off because of your ‚Äútoxic‚Äù Christian beliefs and you don‚Äôt know what to do;

Maybe you‚Äôre experiencing doubt yourself and facing hard questions about truth, God, the Bible, theology and the gospel.

Some who leave the faith feel wounded by the church. Others feel repressed by some of the moral imperatives found in Scripture. For some, it leads to a custom-made spirituality. For others, deconstructing their faith leads them away from the truth into agnosticism, atheism, the occult, or humanism.

In this seminal book, Alisa Childers, author of Another Gospel?, and Tim Barnett, creator of Red Pen Logic, will help you understand what deconstruction is, where it comes from, why it is compelling to some, and how it disorients the lives of so many. You will be able to think through the main issues around faith deconstruction and explore wise and loving ways to respond from a biblical worldview.

Buy the book here: https://amzn.to/47T68kh

Becket Cook was born and raised in Dallas, Texas. He attended Jesuit College Preparatory
School of Dallas. After graduating from college, Becket moved to Los Angeles to pursue his dream of writing and acting, finding success in both. He eventually went on to become a production designer working with the top photographers and directors in the world on fashion shoots for magazines such as Vogue and Harper‚Äôs Bazaar, and for ad campaigns such as Gap, L'Or√©al Paris, and Nike.
 
Finding a new sense of freedom in L.A., Becket also fully engaged in his new life as a gay man. He had a series of many relationships with men throughout the next fifteen years. 
In September of 2009, Becket met a stranger at a coffee shop in Silver Lake who invited him to his church in Hollywood called Reality L.A. Becket reluctantly agreed to attend the service. After hearing the sermon that Sunday, Becket was utterly transformed by the gospel and gave his life to Christ. He also knew on that day when God revealed Himself to him that homosexuality was a sin and that he could no longer live that life. Becket was more than happy to count everything as loss because of the surpassing worth of knowing Christ Jesus his Lord.

Becket spends much of his time in ministry speaking at churches, universities, and conferences helping believers (and non-believers) understand this issue biblically, theologically, culturally, and personally. Balancing grace and truth when teaching on this subject is of primary importance. His goal is to challenge the current cultural narrative about sexuality in general and homosexuality in particular by demonstrating through his personal testimony and biblical truths that, yes, homosexuality is still a sin, and that following Christ is infinitely more satisfying and joyous.

He has lived all over the world in major cities such as Rome, Vienna, and Tokyo.

Becket graduated from Talbot School of Theology at Biola University in 2017 with a Master of Arts in Theology.

description:

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with Dr. Corey Miller, the president and CEO of Ratio Christi. 
¬†
Ratio Christi wants to keep students strong in their faith so they can withstand the challenges they face as they go out into the world. We do this in three ways.
¬†
Arm Students With Reasons to Follow Christ
We bring faith and logic together to give students thought-out reasons for following Jesus Christ. Our goal is to help Christians work through their doubts, and ultimately share Christ with their peers.

Equip Professors with Tools to Share Their Faith
With the right encouragement, resources, and platform, professors can share their own faith with the students around them and be a light within their spheres of influence. We help provide these tools.

Plant University Clubs Nationwide and Around the World
University students are questioning purpose, faith, and identity. Our nationwide clubs provide a safe place to ask apologetics questions (and give leaders resources to tackle them with confidence).

title: DOUBT: Travis Dickinson Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 144
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with Dr. Travis Dickinson about his latest book, ‚ÄúWandering Toward God: Finding Faith amid Doubts and Big Questions.‚Äù We look at doubt in the life of a Christian. 

Is it wrong to doubt? Many Christians assume that doubt is faith's opposite and that wandering among the hard questions of faith will lead us further and further away from God. True believers, the assumption goes, never waver in their confidence in the fundamental truths of the Christian faith.

Professor and philosopher Travis Dickinson disagrees. Instead, he says, our doubts and hard questions about the faith are actually an important way we can express our commitment and love to God. Doubt isn't our destination but it's an important step on the way. It's possible to wander toward God as we ask our questions honestly, in faith and trust. As we do, we'll discover the truth, goodness, and beauty of God waiting for us.

https://www.travisdickinson.com/

title: Men Erased: Owen Strachan Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep 142
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with Owen Strachan about his new book, ‚ÄúThe War on Men: Why Society Hates Them and Why We Need Them.‚Äù 

Strong men are not ‚Äútoxic.‚Äù If they go away, evil men take their place, and weak men offer no resistance.

The idea that masculine men‚Äîassertive, risk-taking, single-minded‚Äîare a problem to be solved threatens our whole society. The cultural elites cheering the decline of men are trying to erase God‚Äôs design for half of the human race‚Äîthe half that historically provides, protects, and leads for the good of others. The disappearance of the masculine ideal is bad news for men, and it‚Äôs terrible news for women.

What will happen without men of courage and conviction? Who will do the hard jobs that no one else can do? Who will be left to face down evil, strengthen families, build churches, and bolster communities? Owen Strachan addresses those questions in this compelling new book, an inspiring blend of cultural analysis, biblical teaching, and passionate exhortation. Cutting through the ideological fog, he explains what‚Äôs at stake. If men are told they‚Äôre not needed, they disappear, becoming lost men. They get frustrated and lash out, becoming angry men. They go alpha and chase their lusts, becoming exaggerated men. Or they lose their masculinity and embrace effeminacy, becoming soft men.

And yet there is hope, rooted in the wisdom and grace of God. In His kindness, He transforms lost, angry, exaggerated, and soft men into a force for good in this world.

Male or female, if you want to understand manhood better, if you are tired of feminized men, this book is for you. It‚Äôs for struggling sons, disillusioned friends, discouraged coworkers, confused college students, disheartened grandfathers, concerned mothers, and everyone in between.

Owen on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@graceandtruthOS

title: Surprising Aspects of The Atonement: Dr. Jeremy Treat Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 141
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with his pastor, Dr. Jeremy Treat, about his new book on the atonement. You‚Äôll be surprised and edified by this one. 

The atonement is central to Christian theology and essential for following Jesus. In this addition to the Short Studies in Systematic Theology series, pastor Jeremy Treat explains what Scripture teaches about the atonement and how it impacts one‚Äôs daily life. 

Treat demonstrates that the death of Christ is a multi-dimensional work within the story of the kingdom of God. While the accomplishments of the cross are unending (including forgiveness, victory, and renewal), the heart of the cross is substitution‚ÄïJesus dying on behalf of sinners. Christ‚Äôs atoning work reconciles believers to God and to one another, calling them to a life of obedience. This book presents a kingdom-framed, substitution-centered, Trinitarian, integrated, communal, and life-changing approach to the doctrine of atonement.

BUY JEREMY"S BOOK HERE:
https://www.amazon.com/Atonement-Introduction-Studies-Systematic-Theology/dp/1433575698/ref=sr_1_1?crid=JGVTBN0SQCZ7&keywords=the+atonement+jeremy+treat&qid=1698959806&sprefix=the+atonement+%2Caps%2C151&sr=8-1

He eventually went on to become a production designer working with the top photographers and directors in the world on fashion shoots for magazines such as Vogue and Harper‚Äôs Bazaar, and for ad campaigns such as Gap, L'Or√©al Paris, and Nike.
 
Finding a new sense of freedom in L.A., Becket also fully engaged in his new life as a gay man. He had a series of many relationships with men throughout the next fifteen years.

title: 3 Scientific Discoveries Reveal God: Dr. Stephen Meyer Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 140
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

BUY STEPHEN'S BOOK HERE: https://www.amazon.com/Return-God-Hypothesis-Compelling-Scientific/dp/0062071505/ref=tmm_hrd_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8&qid=1697511903&sr=8-1

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with Dr. Stephen Meyer about his book, ‚ÄúReturn of the God Hypothesis: Three Scientific Discoveries That Reveal the Mind Behind the Universe.‚Äù 

The New York Times bestselling author of ‚ÄúDarwin‚Äôs Doubt,‚Äù Stephen Meyer, presents groundbreaking scientific evidence of the existence of God, based on breakthroughs in physics, cosmology, and biology.

Beginning in the late 19th century, many intellectuals began to insist that scientific knowledge conflicts with traditional theistic belief‚Äîthat science and belief in God are ‚Äúat war.‚Äù Philosopher of science Stephen Meyer challenges this view by examining three scientific discoveries with decidedly theistic implications. Building on the case for the intelligent design of life that he developed in Signature in the Cell and Darwin‚Äôs Doubt, Meyer demonstrates how discoveries in cosmology and physics coupled with those in biology help to establish the identity of the designing intelligence behind life and the universe. 

Meyer argues that theism‚Äîwith its affirmation of a transcendent, intelligent and active creator‚Äîbest explains the evidence we have concerning biological and cosmological origins. Previously Meyer refrained from attempting to answer questions about ‚Äúwho‚Äù might have designed life. Now he provides an evidence-based answer to perhaps the ultimate mystery of the universe. In so doing, he reveals a stunning conclusion: the data support not just the existence of an intelligent designer of some kind‚Äîbut the existence of a personal God.

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 140

Even some Christians, swayed by the LGBTQ+ movement, have rejected God‚Äôs word on issues of sexuality and gender in favor of popular opinion. In light of these pressures, it‚Äôs more important than ever to help women see the truth about who God created them to be.

In this powerful book, Rosaria Butterfield uses Scripture to confront 5 common lies about sexuality, faith, feminism, gender roles, and modesty often promoted in our secular culture today. Written in the style of a memoir, this book explores Butterfield‚Äôs personal battle with these lies‚Äïinterwoven with cultural studies, literary criticism, and theology‚Äïto help readers see the beauty in biblical womanhood, marriage, and motherhood.

title: Don't Follow Your Heart: Thaddeus Williams Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 137
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with Dr. Thaddeus Williams about his new book, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt Follow Your Heart: Boldly Breaking the Ten Commandments of Self-Worship.‚Äù We were never meant to bear the impossible weight of creating and sustaining our identities, but with the steady stream of propaganda telling us to be true to ourselves and live our best lives, it's no wonder many of us are. In Don't Follow Your Heart, Thaddeus Williams builds a case that self-worship is not authentic, it's arrogant. It is not satisfying, it robs us of awe. It is hardly new and edgy, but is hopelessly traditionalist, rehashing what is literally humanity's oldest lie.

As he explores the Ten Commandments of Self-Worship, Williams calls for a new generation of heretics, iconoclasts, renegades, mavericks, and rebels who refuse to march like good little cows, mooing in unison with the herd. He points us to a life beyond the boring, conventional, and self-defeating dogmas of self-worship and shows us how much more meaningful a life centered on God can truly be.

title: Street Smarts: How to Engage Non-Believers: Greg Koukl Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 135
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with Greg Koukl about his new book, ‚ÄúStreet Smarts: Using Questions to Answer Christianity‚Äôs Toughest Challenges.‚Äù Street Smarts helps Christians better engage in productive conversations with those who challenge their convictions on a variety of issues. A follow-up to Koukl's best-selling Tactics, this book focuses on revealing the fundamental flaws in common, current challenges to Christian beliefs and values. It then provides individual strategies to exploit those shortcomings by offering model questions and sample dialogues to help guide believers in genial, yet persuasive, conversations.

Koukl begins by explaining the important difference in evangelism between a harvest approach (reaping) and a gardening approach (sowing). He then provides an overview of the tactical game plan he uses to have fruitful "gardening" conversations with those who are not yet Christians. Subsequent chapters tackle specific areas of challenge that Christians frequently face in discussions "on the street," as it were--in those conversations with friends, family, or critics that believers often avoid because they feel out of their element, vulnerable, or exposed.

Street Smarts equips Christians to handle tough challenges in a straightforward and user-friendly way. It provides the practical tools they need to keep them in the driver's seat of otherwise difficult and discomfiting conversations. It enables them to stand up for Christ in a safe, genial, yet effective way.

Pre-Order Greg Koukl's Book: https://www.zondervan.com/p/street-smarts/

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 135

ABOUT BECKET:
Becket Cook was born and raised in Dallas, Texas. He attended Jesuit College Preparatory
School of Dallas. After graduating from college, Becket moved to Los Angeles to pursue his dream of writing and acting, finding success in both. He eventually went on to become a production designer working with the top photographers and directors in the world on fashion shoots for magazines such as Vogue and Harper‚Äôs Bazaar, and for ad campaigns such as Gap, L'Or√©al Paris, and Nike.
 
Finding a new sense of freedom in L.A., Becket also fully engaged in his new life as a gay man. He had a series of many relationships with men throughout the next fifteen years. 
In September of 2009, Becket met a stranger at a coffee shop in Silver Lake who invited him to his church in Hollywood called Reality L.A. Becket reluctantly agreed to attend the service. After hearing the sermon that Sunday, Becket was utterly transformed by the gospel and gave his life to Christ. He also knew on that day when God revealed Himself to him that homosexuality was a sin and that he could no longer live that life. Becket was more than happy to count everything as loss because of the surpassing worth of knowing Christ Jesus his Lord.

Becket spends much of his time in ministry speaking at churches, universities, and conferences helping believers (and non-believers) understand this issue biblically, theologically, culturally, and personally. Balancing grace and truth when teaching on this subject is of primary importance. His goal is to challenge the current cultural narrative about sexuality in general and homosexuality in particular by demonstrating through his personal testimony and biblical truths that, yes, homosexuality is still a sin, and that following Christ is infinitely more satisfying and joyous.

He has lived all over the world in major cities such as Rome, Vienna, and Tokyo.

Becket graduated from Talbot School of Theology at Biola University in 2017 with a Master of Arts in Theology. 

Becket‚Äôs book, A Change of Affection: A Gay Man‚Äôs Incredible Story of Redemption, with a 
foreword by Francis Chan, published by Thomas Nelson, released July 30, 2019.

title: Are You a Courageous Christian? Ken Harrison Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 133
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with the CEO of Promise Keepers, Ken Harrison, on what it means to be a courageous Christian in a cowardly world. Ken also tells wild stories of his time as an officer in the LAPD and of an accident he was involved in that changed his life and walk with the Lord. 

Are you ready to stop wasting time and start turning your mundane life into one of adventure and blessing? Ken Harrison weaves together powerful stories and deep truths from Scripture to point you to the life for which God has called you.

Ask Christians what they expect to happen to them after they die, and most will say they will go to heaven. And they‚Äôll probably say that they will meet Jesus and hope to hear Him say, ‚ÄúWell done good and faithful servant.‚Äù But many believers know they are not living up to God‚Äôs calling on their lives. In fact, many might even admit their lives don‚Äôt honor God at all‚Äîat least Mondays through Saturdays.

Ken's Book "A Daring Faith in a Cowardly World" - https://amzn.to/479LkFp

title: The Death of Darwin (Evolution): Dr. David Berlinski Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 129
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with Dr. David Berlinski on his new book, Science After Babel. They discuss the deep flaws in Darwin‚Äôs theory of evolution, free will, and God.

David Berlinski received his Ph.D. in philosophy from Princeton University and was later a postdoctoral fellow in mathematics and molecular biology at Columbia University. He is currently a Senior Fellow at Discovery Institute's Center for Science and Culture. Dr. Berlinski has authored works on systems analysis, differential topology, theoretical biology, analytic philosophy, and the philosophy of mathematics, as well as three novels. He has also taught philosophy, mathematics and English at such universities as Stanford, Rutgers, the City University of New York and the Universite de Paris. In addition, he has held research fellowships at the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA) in Austria and the Institut des Hautes Etudes Scientifiques (IHES) in France.

He is author of numerous books, including A Tour of the Calculus (Pantheon 1996), The Advent of the Algorithm (2000, Harcourt Brace), Newton's Gift (The Free Press 2000), The Secrets of the Vaulted Sky (Harcourt, October 2003), A Short History of Mathematics for the Modern Library series at Random House (2004), The Devil's Delusion: Atheism and Its Scientific Pretensions (Crown Forum, 2008), and The King of Infinite Space: Euclid and His Elements (Basic Books, 2013), Human Nature (and Science After Babel (Discovery Institute Press, 2023). 

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 129

title: The War on Men: Nancy Pearcey Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 128
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with bestselling author Professor Nancy Pearcey on her fascinating new book, "The Toxic War on Masculinity: How Christianity Reconciles the Sexes."

"Why Can't We Hate Men?" asks a headline in the Washington Post. A trendy hashtag is #KillAllMen. Books are sold titled I Hate Men, The End of Men, and Are Men Necessary?
How did the idea arise that masculinity is dangerous and destructive? Nancy Pearcey leads you on a fascinating excursion through American history to discover why the script for masculinity turned toxic‚Äîand how to fix it.

Pearcey then turns to surprising findings from sociology. Religion is often cast as a cause of domestic abuse. But research shows that authentically committed Christian men test out as the most loving and engaged husbands and fathers. They have the lowest rates of divorce and domestic violence of any group in America.

Yes, domestic abuse is an urgent issue, and Pearcey does not mince words in addressing it. But the sociological facts explode the negative stereotypes and show that Christianity has the power to overcome toxic behavior in men and reconcile the sexes‚Äîan unexpected finding that has stood up to rigorous empirical testing.

"The Toxic War on Masculinity" - https://amzn.to/3JcJVDF

https://www.nancypearcey.com/

description:

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket talks with historical theologian, Gavin Ortlund, about key questions regarding Roman Catholicism: the apocrypha, purgatory, the Pope, praying to saints and Mary, the assumption of Mary, the immaculate conception, transubstantiation, the Lord‚Äôs Supper, Sola Scripture, and what the Greek word, theotokos (God bearer), really means. Gavin‚Äôs examination of the history of these dogmas is extremely fascinating and edifying. This one is a must watch!

ABOUT BECKET:
Becket Cook was born and raised in Dallas, Texas. He attended Jesuit College Preparatory
School of Dallas. After graduating from college, Becket moved to Los Angeles to pursue his dream of writing and acting, finding success in both. He eventually went on to become a production designer working with the top photographers and directors in the world on fashion shoots for magazines such as Vogue and Harper‚Äôs Bazaar, and for ad campaigns such as Gap, L'Or√©al Paris, and Nike.
 
Finding a new sense of freedom in L.A., Becket also fully engaged in his new life as a gay man. He had a series of many relationships with men throughout the next fifteen years. 
In September of 2009, Becket met a stranger at a coffee shop in Silver Lake who invited him to his church in Hollywood called Reality L.A. Becket reluctantly agreed to attend the service. After hearing the sermon that Sunday, Becket was utterly transformed by the gospel and gave his life to Christ. He also knew on that day when God revealed Himself to him that homosexuality was a sin and that he could no longer live that life. Becket was more than happy to count everything as loss because of the surpassing worth of knowing Christ Jesus his Lord.

Becket spends much of his time in ministry speaking at churches, universities, and conferences helping believers (and non-believers) understand this issue biblically, theologically, culturally, and personally. Balancing grace and truth when teaching on this subject is of primary importance. His goal is to challenge the current cultural narrative about sexuality in general and homosexuality in particular by demonstrating through his personal testimony and biblical truths that, yes, homosexuality is still a sin, and that following Christ is infinitely more satisfying and joyous.

title: Unexpected Signs Pointing to God: Os Guinness Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 119
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, I talk with Os Guinness about his new book, ‚ÄúSignals of Transcendence: Listening to the Promptings of Life.‚Äù We talk of several notable people who came to faith in Christ by paying attention to these signals. 

The modern world is a place of great distraction, and it can be difficult to make sense of our human existence. But at some point in our lives, we may experience particular moments that prompt us to search for something deeper. Sociologist Peter Berger described these hints and clues as "signals of transcendence" that awaken us to unseen realities.

Os Guinness tells stories of people who experienced signals of transcendence and followed them to find new meaning and purpose in life. Notable figures such as Leo Tolstoy and C. S. Lewis as well as lesser-known individuals experienced a variety of promptings that signaled to them that life could not continue as they had thought. Through unsatisfied longings or disillusionments that yet yielded glimpses of beauty or joy, these moments drew people toward epiphanies of transformation. And the same can be true for us, should we have the courage to follow the signals wherever they may lead.

"Signals of Transcendence" - https://amzn.to/41sVLAz

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 119

title: The Anti-Gospel "Woke" Church: Lucas Miles Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 118
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, I talk with Pastor Lucas Miles about his new book, ‚ÄúWoke Jesus: The False Messiah Destroying Christianity.‚Äù Today‚Äôs social justice movements call for equality, civil rights, love . . . solid Christian values, right? What if there is more to social justice than Christians understand? Even worse: What if we have been duped into preaching ideas that actually oppose the Kingdom of God?

Woke Jesus uncovers the real dangers to Christianity and America from the Christian Left, Progressive or Woke Christianity. These radical alternatives abandon traditional biblical interpretations regarding marriage, gender, racial equality, justice, original sin, heaven and hell, and salvation, replacing them within a new fabricated morality. This fabrication is built around political correctness, cancel culture, hedonistic values, obsession with public health, allegiance to the leftist state, universalism, and virtue signaling.

Author Lucas Miles‚Äî a pastor and trusted voice in the American church who has consistently addressed some of the most challenging topics in religion‚Äînot only outlines how the radical left wing is co-opting Jesus for their own anti-religious views, but also provides a call to action for Christians to resist the siren song of social justice and Wokeism. Rather than ignoring the problems within the church, Miles shows Christians how to grow in the truth of God‚Äôs word by expanding their understanding of solid orthodox theology.

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 118

title: Prison, Fame & Christ: Cynthia Garrett Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 115
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket talks with Cynthia Garrett about her wild journey to faith in Christ. Sitting in an Italian prison for a crime she did not commit, she had a miraculous encounter that led her to the Lord. Facing up to two years in prison, she actually escaped Italy, fled to Switzerland, and made it back to Los Angeles. Upon her return, she wound up becoming very successful in Hollywood, hosting shows on VH1 and her own late night talk show on NBC ("Later with Cynthia Garrett"). After years of success, she realized she hadn‚Äôt fully made Jesus Lord of her life. She finally submitted completely. Her story is stunning. Talk about amazing grace.

Cynthia's Website: https://www.cynthiagarrett.org/

title: How to Grieve a Great Loss: Tim Challies Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 114
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket talks with pastor and author, Tim Challies, about his book, ‚ÄúSeasons of Sorrow: The Pain of Loss and the Comfort of God.‚Äù 

On November 3, 2020, Tim and Aileen Challies received the shocking news that their son Nick had died. A twenty-year-old student at The Southern Baptist Theological Seminary in Louisville, Kentucky, he had been participating in a school activity with his fianc√©e, sister, and friends, when he fell unconscious and collapsed to the ground.

Neither students nor a passing doctor nor paramedics were able to revive him. His parents received the news at their home in Toronto and immediately departed for Louisville to be together as a family. While on the plane, Tim, an author and blogger, began to process his loss through writing. In Seasons of Sorrow, Tim shares real-time reflections from the first year of grief‚Äîthrough the seasons from fall to summer‚Äîintroducing readers to what he describes as the ‚Äúministry of sorrow.‚Äù

Seasons of Sorrow will benefit both those that are working through sorrow or those comforting others:
‚Ä¢ See how God is sovereign over loss and that he is good in loss
‚Ä¢ Discover how you can pass through times of grief while keeping your faith
‚Ä¢ Learn how biblical doctrine can work itself out even in life‚Äôs most difficult situations
‚Ä¢ Understand how it is possible to love God more after loss than you loved him before

Tim's Website: https://www.challies.com/
Buy Tim's Book "Seasons of Sorrow" here: https://amzn.to/3xLn0sQ

title: How Christianity Remade the World: Tom Holland Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 112
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket talks with the British historian, Tom Holland, about his brilliant book, ‚ÄúDominion: How the Christian Revolution Remade the World.‚Äù We look at how Christian assumptions are underneath practically everything, including the French Revolution, Harvey Weinstein & #METOO, and the Women‚Äôs March. Time itself is grounded in Christianity in terms of the calendar we use‚ÄîB.C (before Christ) and A.D. (anno domini ‚Äì the year of our Lord). Our entire society is saturated by Christian concepts and assumptions. 
¬†
About the book:
Crucifixion, the Romans believed, was the worst fate imaginable, a punishment reserved for slaves. How astonishing it was, then, that people should have come to believe that one particular victim of crucifixion-an obscure provincial by the name of Jesus-was to be worshipped as a god.¬†Dominion¬†explores the implications of this shocking conviction as they have reverberated throughout history. Today, the West remains utterly saturated by Christian assumptions. As Tom Holland demonstrates, our morals and ethics are not universal but are instead the fruits of a very distinctive civilization. Concepts such as secularism, liberalism, science, and homosexuality are deeply rooted in a Christian seedbed. From Babylon to the Beatles, Saint Michael to #MeToo,¬†Dominion¬†tells the story of how Christianity transformed the modern world.

title: Trans Ideology Tearing Families Apart: Brandon Showalter Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 108
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://omny.fm/shows/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket interviews Christian Post writer, Brandon Showalter, about the new documentary on trans ideology and how it tears families apart called, Dead Name. 
¬†
Here is the description of the documentary:
Dead Name, the indie documentary, is not fiery or provocative or slick or political. Rather, it's an intimate portrait of three parents whose lives have been shaken and forever altered because their children have declared (or have been given) a transgender identity. In an hour-length film that weaves back and forth among mostly three stories, we learn how shocking it is for parents to hear that their children in their mid to late teens have seemingly out of nowhere decided to switch from female to male or from male to female. In another story, we follow one parent's nightmarish descent into the transgender world as her ex assigns a female gender to their very young son. In all these stories, we find parents struggling with disbelief, loneliness, helplessness, isolation and despair. Ultimately, each one's ultimate fear is the medicalized transition of their child -- though in one story, the path to medicalization may have proven to be fatal.
Dead Name lets us in on the inner thoughts, the struggles, and the declarations to fight for children who feel lost to them.
We have made Dead Name to open the conversation, humanize the subject from the perspective of parents, and give them a voice.

Dead Name Documentary: https://www.deadnamedocumentary.com/
Brandon's Article: https://www.christianpost.com/voices/yes-trans-surgeries-are-being-done-on-minors-heres-proof.html

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 108

ABOUT BECKET:
Becket Cook was born and raised in Dallas, Texas. He attended Jesuit College Preparatory
School of Dallas. After graduating from college, Becket moved to Los Angeles to pursue his dream of writing and acting, finding success in both. He eventually went on to become a production designer working with the top photographers and directors in the world on fashion shoots for magazines such as Vogue and Harper‚Äôs Bazaar, and for ad campaigns such as Gap, L'Or√©al Paris, and Nike.
 
Finding a new sense of freedom in L.A., Becket also fully engaged in his new life as a gay man. He had a series of many relationships with men throughout the next fifteen years. 
In September of 2009, Becket met a stranger at a coffee shop in Silver Lake who invited him to his church in Hollywood called Reality L.A. Becket reluctantly agreed to attend the service. After hearing the sermon that Sunday, Becket was utterly transformed by the gospel and gave his life to Christ. He also knew on that day when God revealed Himself to him that homosexuality was a sin and that he could no longer live that life. Becket was more than happy to count everything as loss because of the surpassing worth of knowing Christ Jesus his Lord.

Becket spends much of his time in ministry speaking at churches, universities, and conferences helping believers (and non-believers) understand this issue biblically, theologically, culturally, and personally. Balancing grace and truth when teaching on this subject is of primary importance. His goal is to challenge the current cultural narrative about sexuality in general and homosexuality in particular by demonstrating through his personal testimony and biblical truths that, yes, homosexuality is still a sin, and that following Christ is infinitely more satisfying and joyous.

He has lived all over the world in major cities such as Rome, Vienna, and Tokyo.

Becket graduated from Talbot School of Theology at Biola University in 2017 with a Master of Arts in Theology. 

Becket‚Äôs book, A Change of Affection: A Gay Man‚Äôs Incredible Story of Redemption, with a 
foreword by Francis Chan, published by Thomas Nelson, released July 30, 2019.

TBCS theme song by Seth Kaye

In today‚Äôs episode, I chat with AJ Hurley, a pro-life activist who was the man behind photographing the aborted babies in D.C. that went viral with the hashtag ‚ÄúJustice for the Five.‚Äù His story of how he came to be there at that moment is amazing. description:

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket looks at a recently discovered prayer letter from his mother to God regarding becket‚Äôs homosexuality. description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://www.spreaker.com/show/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket looks at the story of Amy Grant hosting her niece‚Äôs lesbian wedding on her farm. Amy calls it love but what is love according to the Bible? Becket looks Franklin Graham‚Äôs response to her hosting this wedding as well as another Christian writer who wrote a piece on this. Becket also talks about the time he attended a gay wedding and how and why he regrets this decision. Finally, Becket discusses whether a Christian should go to a gay wedding or not.

title: The Slow Death of Marriage - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 104
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://www.spreaker.com/show/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket looks at the so-called, ‚ÄúRespect for Marriage Act,‚Äù that was signed into law by President Biden a few weeks ago. I share a story of how I was ardently pro-gay marriage when I was dating a guy from Rome. I also share the story of my sending a letter to then President Bill Clinton expressing my frustrations over the prohibition of gay marriage and receiving a letter back from him laying out his views at the time. 
¬†
‚ÄúGay marriage‚Äù may seem innocuous, but it actually has a very detrimental impact on society. I get into all of the reasons why. 
¬†
Finally, I look at a possible solution to ‚Äúgay marriage.‚Äù It‚Äôs an unexpected idea that could really work.

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 104

title: Free to Be You and Me? - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 103
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://www.spreaker.com/show/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket looks at the 50th anniversary of the wildly popular children‚Äôs album, ‚ÄúFree to Be Me and You,‚Äù by Marlo Thomas. Released in 1972, we see how this album indoctrinated a generation with its feminist undertones, and helped pit men and women against each other, leading to all sorts of societal (and church) ills: divorce, broken families, anxiety, depression, and so on. Becket uncovers the link of this album to today‚Äôs gender madness. It‚Äôs surprising how a seemingly innocent children‚Äôs album could wreak so much havoc.

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 103

title: Texas Oil Heiress's Story of Faith: June Hunt Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 102

ABOUT BECKET:
Becket Cook was born and raised in Dallas, Texas. He attended Jesuit College Preparatory
School of Dallas. After graduating from college, Becket moved to Los Angeles to pursue his dream of writing and acting, finding success in both. He eventually went on to become a production designer working with the top photographers and directors in the world on fashion shoots for magazines such as Vogue and Harper‚Äôs Bazaar, and for ad campaigns such as Gap, L'Or√©al Paris, and Nike.
 
Finding a new sense of freedom in L.A., Becket also fully engaged in his new life as a gay man. He had a series of many relationships with men throughout the next fifteen years. 
In September of 2009, Becket met a stranger at a coffee shop in Silver Lake who invited him to his church in Hollywood called Reality L.A. Becket reluctantly agreed to attend the service. After hearing the sermon that Sunday, Becket was utterly transformed by the gospel and gave his life to Christ. He also knew on that day when God revealed Himself to him that homosexuality was a sin and that he could no longer live that life. Becket was more than happy to count everything as loss because of the surpassing worth of knowing Christ Jesus his Lord.

Becket spends much of his time in ministry speaking at churches, universities, and conferences helping believers (and non-believers) understand this issue biblically, theologically, culturally, and personally. Balancing grace and truth when teaching on this subject is of primary importance. His goal is to challenge the current cultural narrative about sexuality in general and homosexuality in particular by demonstrating through his personal testimony and biblical truths that, yes, homosexuality is still a sin, and that following Christ is infinitely more satisfying and joyous.

He has lived all over the world in major cities such as Rome, Vienna, and Tokyo.

Becket graduated from Talbot School of Theology at Biola University in 2017 with a Master of Arts in Theology. 

Becket‚Äôs book, A Change of Affection: A Gay Man‚Äôs Incredible Story of Redemption, with a 
foreword by Francis Chan, published by Thomas Nelson, released July 30, 2019.

TBCS theme song by Seth Kaye

#TheBecketCookShow #junehunt

title: A Wake Up Call for the Church: Eric Metaxas Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 99
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://www.spreaker.com/show/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, I chat with Eric Metaxas¬†about his new book, ‚ÄúLetter to the American Church.‚Äù In an earnest and searing wake-up call, Eric warns of the haunting similarities between today‚Äôs American church and the German church of the 1930s. Echoing Bonhoeffer‚Äôs prophetic call, Eric Metaxas exhorts his fellow Christians to repent of their silence in the face of evil before it is too late. Can it really be God‚Äôs will that His children be silent at a time like this? Decrying the cowardice that masquerades as godly meekness, Eric Metaxas summons the Church to battle. An attenuated and unbiblical ‚Äúfaith‚Äù based on what Bonhoeffer called ‚Äúcheap grace‚Äù has sapped the spiritual vitality of millions of Americans. Paying lip service to an insipid ‚Äúevangelism,‚Äù they shrink from combating the evils of our time. Metaxas refutes the pernicious lie that fighting evil politicizes Christianity. As Bonhoeffer and other heroes of the faith insisted, the Church has an irreplaceable role in the culture of a nation. It is our duty to fight the powers of darkness, especially on behalf of the weak and vulnerable.Silence is not an option. God calls us to defend the unborn, to confront the lies of cultural Marxism, and to battle the globalist tyranny that crushes human freedom. Confident that this is His fight, the Church must overcome fear and enter the fray, armed with the spiritual weapons of prayer, self-sacrifice, and love.

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 99

title: Christian Conference Embraces LGBTQ+ Ideology: Dr. Denny Burk Interview -  Becket Cook Show Ep. 98
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://www.spreaker.com/show/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket talks with Dr. Denny Burk, president of The Council for Biblical Manhood and Womanhood, about the recent Revoice conference held in Dallas, Texas. Revoice is the organization of Christians who maintain a belief in Biblical orthodoxy related to sexuality, but still identify themselves as ‚Äúgay,‚Äù or ‚Äúqueer,‚Äù etc. We get into some of the shocking things that were said and done during this conference (e.g. Organizers handed out name tags and instructed attendees to select a sticker with their preferred pronouns to wear and tote bags/tees with slogans such as ‚ÄúQueer Today, Queer Tomorrow.‚Äù Speakers frequently referred to ‚Äúsexual and gender minorities‚Äù along with terms such as women ‚Äúassigned female at birth.‚Äù One presenter was introduced using ‚Äúthey/them‚Äù pronouns and wore a black T-shirt w/ the inscription, ‚ÄúImago Dei‚Äù in transgender flag colors. This is an important episode for the church.

Dr. Burk's Website: https://www.dennyburk.com/
The Council of Biblical Manhood and Womanhood's Website: https://cbmw.org/

The Articles: 
https://wng.org/articles/identity-crisis-1666367393 
https://cbmw.org/2022/10/24/report-says-revoice-embraces-radical-gender-ideology/

description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with M.D. Perkins about his new book, ‚ÄúDangerous Affirmation: The Threat of ‚ÄòGay Christianity‚Äô‚Äù 

Since 1968, the LGBT movement has made significant inroads into the Christian church. The affirming church movement has become mainstream through the erosion of mainline denominations. Queer theology has taken hold in many academic settings. The emergence of ‚Äúgay celibate theology‚Äù is causing confusion in evangelical churches through its appeal to modern psychology and LGBT-lived experience. How did we get here? What does the Bible say about all of this?

‚ÄúDangerous Affirmation‚Äù is an insightful analysis of the influence and spread of ‚Äúgay Christianity.‚Äù Author M.D. Perkins exposes the way this movement handles theology, biblical interpretation, the church, personal and group identity, and political activism. While many Christians are being won over by this immoral cause, this book serves as a sober-minded call to faithfulness in the midst of cultural and religious chaos.

title: From Gang Member to Christ: Casey Diaz Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 94
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: https://www.spreaker.com/show/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, I chat with Casey Diaz about his book, ‚ÄúThe Shot Caller: A Latino Gangbanger‚Äôs Miraculous Escape from a Life of Violence to a New Life in Christ.‚Äù His story will absolutely amaze you! The son of El Salvadorian immigrants, Casey Diaz was brought to Los Angeles at the age of two. An abusive, impoverished family life propelled Casey at only eleven years of age into the Rockwood Street Locos gang. Casey was willing to do anything to be number one, but years of chasing rival gang members led to a dramatic ambush and arrest by the LAPD.

At just sixteen, Casey was sentenced to more than twelve years in solitary confinement in California‚Äôs toughest prison as one of the state‚Äôs most violent offenders. He thought his life was over.

Yet, when a determined elderly woman paid Casey a visit, a whole new world of possibilities began to unfold. Casey scoffed as she quietly insisted God was going to use him. As the days in solitary wore on, Casey realized Someone else was calling the shots. What happened next can only be described as a miracle.

Buy "The Shot Caller" here: https://amzn.to/3RPZP8m

title: One Lie at a Time - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 90
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to the podcast version here: 
https://www.spreaker.com/show/the-becket-cook-show

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket goes back to the 70s and looks at the popular sitcom, ‚ÄúOne Day at a Time.‚Äù He examines a scene from an episode called, ‚ÄúPressure,‚Äù where Barbara, who is now 18 years old, is considering sleeping with her boyfriend. She tries, in vain, to get sound advice from her mother and sister. No one has a good answer because they are operating within a secular humanistic worldview. They can only look within. Of course, this was an early iteration of what‚Äôs plaguing our culture today: look within, follow your heart, you be you, etc. It‚Äôs amazing how we have been indoctrinated in this stiff since the 70s‚Ä¶and before.

ABOUT BECKET:
Becket Cook was born and raised in Dallas, Texas. He attended Jesuit College Preparatory
School of Dallas. After graduating from Austin College in Texas, Becket moved to Los Angeles to pursue his dream of writing and acting, finding success in both. He eventually went on to become a production designer working with the top photographers and directors in the world on fashion shoots for magazines such as Vogue and Harper‚Äôs Bazaar, and for ad campaigns such as Gap, L'Or√©al Paris, and Nike.
 
Finding a new sense of freedom in L.A., Becket also fully engaged in his new life as a gay man. He had a series of many relationships with men throughout the next fifteen years. 
In September of 2009, Becket met a stranger at a coffee shop in Silver Lake who invited him to his church in Hollywood called Reality L.A. Becket reluctantly agreed to attend the service. After hearing the sermon that Sunday, Becket was utterly transformed by the gospel and gave his life to Christ. He also knew on that day when God revealed Himself to him that homosexuality was a sin and that he could no longer live that life. Becket was more than happy to count everything as loss because of the surpassing worth of knowing Christ Jesus his Lord.

Becket spends much of his time in ministry speaking at churches, universities, and conferences helping believers (and non-believers) understand this issue biblically, theologically, culturally, and personally. Balancing grace and truth when teaching on this subject is of primary importance. His goal is to challenge the current cultural narrative about sexuality in general and homosexuality in particular by demonstrating through his personal testimony and biblical truths that, yes, homosexuality is still a sin, and that following Christ is infinitely more satisfying and joyous.

He has lived all over the world in major cities such as Rome, Vienna, and Tokyo.

Becket graduated from Talbot School of Theology at Biola University in 2017 with a Master of Arts in Theology. 

Becket‚Äôs book, A Change of Affection: A Gay Man‚Äôs Incredible Story of Redemption, with a 
foreword by Francis Chan, published by Thomas Nelson, released July 30, 2019.

description:
