In today‚Äôs episode, Becket takes a look at a New York Times article on J-Lo and Ben Affleck. The writer of the article is aghast that Jennifer Lopez took Ben Affleck‚Äôs last name. Becket explores the feminist underpinnings of the op-ed and counters it with a biblical foundation, particularly in Ephesians chapter 5. Even though Jennifer Lopez now calls herself Mrs. Affleck, the writer keeps referring to her as Ms. Affleck and castigates her for taking Ben‚Äôs name. We see how pitting women against men is destructive to marriage, the family, and society at large.

description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket chats with author Brett McCracken about his latest book, ‚ÄúThe Wisdom Pyramid: Feeding Your Soul in a Post-Truth World.‚Äù Brett unpacks what it looks like to live wisely as a Christian in an age of constant distraction. With the quick tap of the finger, we can access an endless stream of addictive information. Accessing information has never been easier‚Äîbut acquiring wisdom is increasingly difficult. In an effort to help us consume a more balanced, healthy diet of information, Brett has created the ‚ÄúWisdom Pyramid,‚Äù challenging us to increase our intake of enduring, trustworthy sources (like the Bible) while moderating our consumption of less reliable sources (like the Internet and social media). Brett helps us with a healthier approach at a time when so much of our daily media diet is toxic and making us spiritually sick. You‚Äôll walk away from this conversation uplifted and encouraged.

description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to all podcast episodes here: https://thebecketcookshow.buzzsprout.com/

In today‚Äôs episode, Becket takes a look at the phenomenon called, ‚Äútrans regret.‚Äù Many teens, both boys and girls, who decided that they were trans and ended up taking puberty blockers, testosterone, and even getting a double mastectomy (or in the case of boys, castration), now deeply regret their decision. We see how this so-called ‚Äúgender-affirming care,‚Äù promoted by much of society including the President of the United States himself, is really child abuse. Becket reminds us that in the 90s, Hillary Clinton was on a campaign to end genital mutilation in African countries. But she is silent on this current twist of genital mutilation on American teens sucked into a deeply wicked gender ideology.

The Michael Knowles Interview with Helena Kerschner: https://bit.ly/3wYZ0ln

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 76

ABOUT BECKET:
Becket Cook was born and raised in Dallas, Texas. He attended Jesuit College Preparatory
School of Dallas. After graduating from Austin College in Texas, Becket moved to Los Angeles to pursue his dream of writing and acting, finding success in both. He eventually went on to become a production designer working with the top photographers and directors in the world on fashion shoots for magazines such as Vogue and Harper‚Äôs Bazaar, and for ad campaigns such as Gap, L'Or√©al Paris, and Nike.
 
Finding a new sense of freedom in L.A., Becket also fully engaged in his new life as a gay man. He had a series of many relationships with men throughout the next fifteen years. 
In September of 2009, Becket met a stranger at a coffee shop in Silver Lake who invited him to his church in Hollywood called Reality L.A. Becket reluctantly agreed to attend the service. After hearing the sermon that Sunday, Becket was utterly transformed by the gospel and gave his life to Christ. He also knew on that day when God revealed Himself to him that homosexuality was a sin and that he could no longer live that life. Becket was more than happy to count everything as loss because of the surpassing worth of knowing Christ Jesus his Lord.

Becket spends much of his time in ministry speaking at churches, universities, and conferences helping believers (and non-believers) understand this issue biblically, theologically, culturally, and personally. Balancing grace and truth when teaching on this subject is of primary importance. His goal is to challenge the current cultural narrative about sexuality in general and homosexuality in particular by demonstrating through his personal testimony and biblical truths that, yes, homosexuality is still a sin, and that following Christ is infinitely more satisfying and joyous.

He has lived all over the world in major cities such as Rome, Vienna, and Tokyo.

Becket graduated from Talbot School of Theology at Biola University in 2017 with a Master of Arts in Theology. 

Becket‚Äôs book, A Change of Affection: A Gay Man‚Äôs Incredible Story of Redemption, with a 
foreword by Francis Chan, published by Thomas Nelson, released July 30, 2019.

TBCS theme song by Seth Kaye

#TheBecketCookShow #transgender #socialcontagion

title: This Ends the Abortion Debate: Megan Almon Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 74
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to all podcast episodes here: https://thebecketcookshow.buzzsprout.com/

In today's episode, Becket talks with Megan Almon about the recently leaked draft of the Supreme Court majority opinion on Roe v. Wade and its consequences. Megan, who speaks on abortion for Stand to Reason lays out the pro-life case and shows the flawed logic behind the pro-abortion stance. Her compelling arguments help refute the illogical, immoral, and philosophical arguments used by the pro-choice camp. What makes our life valuable? Why do we have dignity? How does the Imago Dei impact this debate? Is the pro-life movement only concerned with unborn children? What about after birth? Megan answers all of these questions and more.

Megan's website: prolifetraining.com

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 74

title: Tactics For Defending the Faith: Alan Shlemon Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 73
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to all podcast episodes here: https://thebecketcookshow.buzzsprout.com/

In today's episode, Becket chats with Stand to Reason's Alan Shlemon about very interesting ways to defend the faith and share the Gospel. Alan lays out various strategies, including the "Columbo" and the "Taking the Roof Off" tactics. You will be surprised, edified, and encouraged by this episode. We also learn the difference between an "argument" and a "burden of proof." Alan gives great illustrations of how these tactics work in real life. We even do a role play where I pretend to be a skeptic and he uses the tactics on me. The goal of these tactics is to "put a stone in the skeptic's shoe." 

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 73

title: The Teen Suicide Epidemic: Jon Noyes Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 72
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to all podcast episodes here: https://thebecketcookshow.buzzsprout.com/

In today's episode, Becket chats with Stand to Reason's Jon Noyes about the teenage mental health crisis in the United States. Jon answers: 
1. Why is this important? 
2. Why do people contemplate suicide? 
3. What can we do?
Jon gives us amazing stories of teenagers changing their mind about suicide after hearing him give his talk at these conferences. He also gives great advice for parents who are dealing with this issue with their children. This topic is too important not to discuss.

The NYT Article: https://nyti.ms/3vmBTl7

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 72

title: Is God a War Criminal? - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 71
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to all podcast episodes here: https://thebecketcookshow.buzzsprout.com/

In today's episode, Becket looks at a New York Times article called "In this Time of War, I Propose We Give Up God" and exposes the ignorance of the writer. Every Christmas and Easter, the New York Times and other media try to undermine the veracity of The Gospel, The Resurrection, God and the Christian Faith. Becket points out the flaws in the article and reveals the biblical truth. Sowing doubt is a favorite past-time of the media, but as Christians we can have confidence in The Gospel and the person and work of Jesus Christ.

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 71

title: We Need to Talk about Sin: Mark Jones Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 70
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to all podcast episodes here: https://thebecketcookshow.buzzsprout.com/

In today's episode, Becket interviews Mark Jones about his wonderful book, "Knowing Sin." We learn about how Adam broke the Ten Commandments in the Garden, Original Sin, the origins of sin, how sin damaged the Image of God in humans, what "privation" and "positive inclination" mean, what indwelling sin really is, and much more. We also discuss why defining sin as "missing the mark" misses the mark! This episode will enlighten, edify, and encourage you. 

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 70

ABOUT BECKET:
Becket Cook was born and raised in Dallas, Texas. He attended Jesuit College Preparatory
School of Dallas. After graduating from Austin College in Texas, Becket moved to Los Angeles to pursue his dream of writing and acting, finding success in both. He eventually went on to become a production designer working with the top photographers and directors in the world on fashion shoots for magazines such as Vogue and Harper‚Äôs Bazaar, and for ad campaigns such as Gap, L'Or√©al Paris, and Nike.
 
Finding a new sense of freedom in L.A., Becket also fully engaged in his new life as a gay man. He had a series of many relationships with men throughout the next fifteen years. 
In September of 2009, Becket met a stranger at a coffee shop in Silver Lake who invited him to his church in Hollywood called Reality L.A. Becket reluctantly agreed to attend the service. After hearing the sermon that Sunday, Becket was utterly transformed by the gospel and gave his life to Christ. He also knew on that day when God revealed Himself to him that homosexuality was a sin and that he could no longer live that life. Becket was more than happy to count everything as loss because of the surpassing worth of knowing Christ Jesus his Lord.

Becket spends much of his time in ministry speaking at churches, universities, and conferences helping believers (and non-believers) understand this issue biblically, theologically, culturally, and personally. Balancing grace and truth when teaching on this subject is of primary importance. His goal is to challenge the current cultural narrative about sexuality in general and homosexuality in particular by demonstrating through his personal testimony and biblical truths that, yes, homosexuality is still a sin, and that following Christ is infinitely more satisfying and joyous.

He has lived all over the world in major cities such as Rome, Vienna, and Tokyo.

Becket graduated from Talbot School of Theology at Biola University in 2017 with a Master of Arts in Theology. 

Becket‚Äôs book, A Change of Affection: A Gay Man‚Äôs Incredible Story of Redemption, with a 
foreword by Francis Chan, published by Thomas Nelson, released July 30, 2019.

title: "I'm a Woman Trapped in a Man's Body:" Carl Trueman Interview - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 67
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to all podcast episodes here: https://thebecketcookshow.buzzsprout.com/

In today's episode, Becket chats with Carl Trueman about his book "The Rise and Triumph of the Modern Self," which explores how we got to this strange place in culture, going all the way back to 18th century philosopher, Jean-Jacques Rousseau to the Romantic poets, Nietzsche, Darwin, Freud, and more. We discover through these key historical figures how our modern world was shaped and the dramatic effects their ideas have had on our culture today including the previously incoherent phrase, "I am a woman trapped in a man's body," and how this phrase came to be known as coherent and meaningful in our world. You will be surprised how far-reaching these ideas are and how they are in the social imaginary whether we realize it or not. This episode will help you understand how we got to the chaos and confusion of our culture in the 21st century. 

Carl R. Trueman's Books:
"The Rise and Triumph of the Modern Self" - https://amzn.to/3L8TMbV
"Strange New World" - https://amzn.to/3qr9gAj

title: Are We Misinterpreting the Bible? Interview with Alan Shlemon - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 65
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

Listen to all podcast episodes here: https://thebecketcookshow.buzzsprout.com/

In today's episode, Becket chats with Alan Shlemon from Stand to Reason about Hermeneutics - the discipline of interpreting the Bible. We learn how context and history play an important role in our understanding, and how modern Christians tend to overlook literary themes when reading scripture. It is important for us in the modern church to respect the history, culture and true meanings behind the biblical text. Applying this discipline is crucial to understanding the Bible correctly, and will help you avoid falling into the common mistakes among Bible readers. Our culture would have us interpret the Bible in whatever way feels best to us, but we need to study the Word of God and its original intended meaning rather than bend it to our own cultural whims. We also discuss commonly misunderstood passages in the Bible. Some of these may shock you. 

Alan Shlemon's website: https://www.str.org/alan-shlemon

The Becket Cook Show Ep. 65

In today's episode, Becket chats with Dr. Sean McDowell about his new book, "Chasing Love: Sex, Love and Relationships in a Confused Culture." Becket and Sean discuss common myths about sex. title: Side A + Side B Christianity:  Rosaria Butterfield & Christopher Yuan - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 58
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

In today's episode, Rosaria Butterfield and Christopher Yuan join Becket to discuss the meaning of "Side A" and "Side B" Christianity. They uncover why both sides have deep theological flaws. They also look into the best ways to think about labels of homosexuals who come to faith. They answer questions like: "Should I go to my son's gay wedding?" This important discussion is crucial to understanding what it means to be a Christian with homosexuality in your biography.

description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

In today's episode Becket interviews J. Warner Wallace on his new book "Person of Interest: Why Jesus Still Matters in a World that Rejects the Bible." J. Warner Wallace is a Dateline featured Cold-Case Detective, Author, Speaker, Senior Fellow at the Colson Center for Christian Worldview, and Adjunct Professor of Apologetics at Talbot School of Theology (Biola University) and Southern Evangelical Seminary and he is a best-selling author of several books, including "Cold-Case Christianity." J. Warner Wallace uses an investigative technique called "fuse and fallout" to prove, beyond a reasonable doubt, that the life and work of Jesus and his resurrection are true. We discover that the circumstantial evidence is so overwhelming that there is nothing left to do but believe.

title: The Real Problem with CRT: Interview with Monique Duson - The Becket Cook Show Ep. 51
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

In today's episode, Becket talks with Monique Duson about Critical Race Theory and how it's actually anti-biblical. We learn of her journey from a CRT activist to rejecting that philosophy and finding the real answers within Scripture. She shares about the extraordinary difficulties of growing up in South Central LA as well as a few harrowing events during her missionary work in South Africa. Monique gives us insight into how to understand racial issues biblically rather than through the lens of a secular humanistic worldview. Monique is a graduate of BIOLA University and currently getting her master's in theology at Talbot School of Theology. Her ministry's aim is to use Scripture to define terms like humanity, race, love, and justice. She wants to bring practical tools for clergy and lay people to walk out the ideals of racial unity and biblical justice.

Monique's Website: https://www.centerforbiblicalunity.com/

Stand To Reason Reality Student Apologetics Conference: http://www.realityapologetics.com/

description:

1. God's design for human sexuality
2. The lies of the culture surrounding sex 
3. The sufficiency of God's grace and singleness
Starting in the 1960's Becket traces key turning points in the culture that have led us to the sexual confusion in all of its forms today. Films, tv and specific cultural moments all play a part in shaping our collective belief systems whether we know it or not.

description:

title: Why is the Family Falling Apart? - The Becket Cook Show Ep.44
description:
Support The Becket Cook Show on Patreon!: https://www.patreon.com/thebecketcookshow

In today's episode, Becket looks at Leviticus 20 and uncovers an often overlooked verse which explains why certain sins carried the death penalty for the Israelites. Any attack on the nuclear family unit was detrimental to the Israelite society as a whole. Looking at those same sins today we see how they are just as destructive - mental illness, drug addiction, homelessness, mass incarceration, violence, antifa, etc. The LGBTQ movement is particularly pernicious on the family and this passage in Leviticus reveals why. Becket references Dr. Michael Heiser's podcast The Naked Bible and quotes from Jonathan Milgram's commentary on Leviticus. What is revealed will surprise you!

The Naked Bible Podcast 80: Leviticus 19-20 -  https://bit.ly/2VGku7Q

ABOUT BECKET:
Becket Cook was born and raised in Dallas, Texas. He attended Jesuit College Preparatory School of Dallas. After graduating from Austin College in Texas, Becket moved to Los Angeles to pursue his dream of writing and acting, finding success in both. He eventually went on to become a production designer working with the top photographers and directors in the world on fashion shoots for magazines such as Vogue and Harper‚Äôs Bazaar, and for ad campaigns such as Gap, L'Or√©al Paris, and Nike. 

Finding a new sense of freedom in L.A., Becket also fully engaged in his new life as a gay man. He had a series of many relationships with men throughout the next fifteen years. In September of 2009, Becket met a stranger at a coffee shop in Silver Lake who invited him to his church in Hollywood called Reality L.A. Becket reluctantly agreed to attend the service. After hearing the sermon that Sunday, Becket was utterly transformed by the gospel and gave his life to Christ. He also knew on that day when God revealed Himself to him that homosexuality was a sin and that he could no longer live that life. Becket was more than happy to count everything as loss because of the surpassing worth of knowing Christ Jesus his Lord.

Becket spends much of his time in ministry speaking at churches, universities, and conferences helping believers (and non-believers) understand this issue biblically, theologically, culturally, and personally. Balancing grace and truth when teaching on this subject is of primary importance. His goal is to challenge the current cultural narrative about sexuality in general and homosexuality in particular by demonstrating through his personal testimony and biblical truths that, yes, homosexuality is still a sin, and that following Christ is infinitely more satisfying and joyous.

He has lived all over the world in major cities such as Rome, Vienna, and Tokyo.

Becket graduated from Talbot School of Theology at Biola University in 2017 with a Master of Arts in Theology. Becket‚Äôs book, A Change of Affection: A Gay Man‚Äôs Incredible Story of Redemption, with a foreword by Francis Chan, published by Thomas Nelson, released July 30, 2019.

What does separation of church and state really mean? Can we separate our worldview from our life choices?

title: The Holy Cook Book Show Ep. 1
description:
Episode 1 of The Holy Cook Book Show w/ Chynna Phillips Baldwin!

Linguine Heirloom Pasta, Butter Lettuce Salad & Garlic Bread. 

Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll need!

Ingredients: 

Becket‚Äôs Sublime Linguine Heirloom Pasta :

1. 1lb Linguine 
2. 4 or 5 Heirloom tomatoes 
3. One Tbsp chopped garlic (optional)
4. Handful of chopped fresh basil 
5. 1/4 cup Olive Oil
6.  1Tbsb cracked Pepper 
7. 1/2 tsp Sea salt 

Butter Lettuce Salad:

1. One head butter lettuce 
2. One large cucumber
3. 1/2 cup shaved parmesan cheese.

Chy‚Äôs Basic Salad Dressing: 

1.Half cup olive oil.
2. 3 pinches of sea salt 
3. 1 Tablespoon of balsamic glaze (or regular balsamic vinegar)
4. Dash of pepper.
5. 1/2 tsp garlic powder. 
6. Tsp of lemon juice (optional)

Garlic Bread: 
1. Frozen garlic bread.
2. 1 stick (at least) of room temperature butter 
3. Garlic powder 
4. Sea salt.
